title: Waterfall plus heatmap module
text: transformation menu offers several possible data transformation Z-score Min-Max. transformation applied parameter (.e. row heatmap) independently. Note Outliers definition, described previous section, affect calculation transformations   default, module include several transformation (See dv.wfphm::wfphm_server full list) user can include custom transformations needed data. function applied row independently, meaning function receives vector values row must returned similar vector transformed values.
code: module_list_custom_transformation <- list( # nolint   "WFPHM" = dv.wfphm::mod_wfphm(     module_id = "wfphm",     tr_mapper = list( # New argument       "Original" = dv.wfphm::tr_identity,       "Mean Centered" = function(x) {         x - mean(x)       }     ),     bm_dataset_name = "adbm",     group_dataset_name = "adsl"   ) )  dv.manager::run_app(   data = list(DS = example_dataset),   module_list = module_list_custom_transformation,   filter_data = "adbm",   filter_key = "SUBJID" )

code: # Assign some labels to the dataset example_dataset_labelled <- example_dataset attr(example_dataset_labelled[["adbm"]][["SUBJID"]], "label") <- "Subject ID" attr(example_dataset_labelled[["adbm"]][["SEX"]], "label") <- "Subject Sex" attr(example_dataset_labelled[["adbm"]][["PARCAT1"]], "label") <- "Parameter Category"  dv.manager::run_app(   data = list(DS = example_dataset_labelled),   module_list = module_list,   filter_data = "adbm",   filter_key = "SUBJID" )

title: Waterfall plus heatmap module
text: mentioned described previous section, though module designed work ADaM Basic Data Structure (BDS) using PARAMCD, can also used generally non-standard datasets similar structure. example, consider example dataset different column names created used app module. can notice, non standard column names used values applicable module arguments.
code: example_dataset <- list(   "adbm" = tibble::tibble(     subject = factor(c(1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 3)),     safety_category = factor(c("PC1", "PC2", "PC1", "PC2", "PC1", "PC2")),     safety_parameter = factor(c("P1", "P2", "P1", "P2", "P1", "P2")),     timepoint = factor(c("V1", "V2", "V1", "V2", "V2", "V1")),     log_aval = log(c(11, 12, 21, 22, 31, 3))   ),   "adsl" = tibble::tibble(     SUBJID = factor(c(1, 2, 3)),     WEIGHT = c(10, 20, 30),     SEX = factor(c("M", "F", "U")),     COUNTRY = factor(c("DE", "US", "DE"))   ) ) module_list <- list(   "WFPHM" = dv.wfphm::mod_wfphm(     module_id = "wfphm",     bm_dataset_name = "adbm",     group_dataset_name = "adsl",     cat_var = "safety_category",     par_var = "safety_parameter",     subjid_var = "subject",     value_vars = c("log_aval"),     visit_var = "timepoint"   ) )  dv.manager::run_app(   data = list(DS = example_dataset_non_standard),   module_list = module_list,   filter_data = "adsl",   filter_key = "subject" # We changed this one too, see dv.manager filtering doc for this change )

title: svg heatmap plot — HM2SVG_plot
text: data data plot. expects following format: - columns names x, y, z , optionally, label - x y columns factors - one entry combination "x" "y" present dataset. words, values heatmap rectangle defined explicitly, even NA - Axis labels legend title stored attribute "label" "x", "y" "z" columns - order records data frame dictates ordering x/y axes final plot x_desc, y_desc, z_desc Indicate absence/presence location axis descriptors (descriptor x y axes plot ticks; z axis legend) - x_desc can take following values: "N" (north), "S" (south), NULL (absent) - y_desc can take following values: "W" (west), "E" (east), NULL (absent) - z_desc can take following values: "N", "E", "S", "W", NULL pal_fun Function maps values column z data color #rrggbb #rrggbbaa format palette Vector maps values "z" colors. names vector hexadecimal colors encoded #rrggbb #rrggbbaa (red, green, blue, alpha) values "z" values mapped color. "z" categorical, palette complete (.e. offer one color per value). "z" continuous, palette contain least two values covering min-max range possible values. contains , color grid rectangle linearly interpolated according value falls two surrounding provided colors. ns namespace apply click events

Extra parameters passed r2d3::d3Output, r2d3::renderD3 r2d3::r2d3 data [data.frame() | shiny::reactive(data.frame) | shinymeta::metaReactive(data.frame)] dataframe plot. expects following format: columns names ar "x", "y", "z" , optionally, "label" "color" one entry combination "x" "y" present dataset. words, values bar defined explicitly, even NA Axis labels legend title stored attribute "label" "x", "y" "z" columns. (Legend title implemented yet) "x" "y" factors. order levels dictates ordering axis. "z" factor double. title: Build a collection of named constants — pack_of_constants
text: Shiny uses strings IDs link UI server elements. E.g: foo_UI(id = ns("foo")) ... foo_server(id = "foo") pattern makes easy programmers fall trap modifying one instance string literal "foo" without modifying rest unaware problem bug hit. also easy mistakes uses "foo" identifier uses (text labels, ...) , often case, parameter explicitly named. One easy fix consists using global variables instead plain string literals. case previous example, mean: ID_FOO <- "foo" foo_UI(ns(ID_FOO)) ... foo_server(ID_FOO) simple addition makes purpose ID_FOO clear also fails gracefully ID_FOO instances updated synchronously along codebase. drawback polluting global namespace identifier variables. easily solved creating container constants, purpose pack_of_constants alias. ID <- pack_of_constants(FOO = "foo", BAR = "bar") ID$FOO "foo" ID$BA Error $.pack_of_constants(ID, BA) : Pack constants "ID" contain "BA" pack constants plain named list enforces elements unique, non-null names. tagged S3 object override extraction operators. use checkmate unnecessary, Good Library(TM) module rely anyways
